title: Integration Reliability Engineer, Technical Operations EMEA
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companiesâ€”from the worldâ€™s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startupsâ€”use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyoneâ€™s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Money Movement Integrations TechOps team owns some of Stripeâ€™s most critical money movement flows and a platform that processes hundreds of billions of dollars in payouts a year. Our team builds and scales the infrastructure and financial partner integrations that enables Stripe to accept, manage, and payout money across many countries, currencies, and payment methods. 
The Money Movement Integrations TechOps team is a key component to Stripeâ€™s global strategy in the EMEA market. Our mission is to reduce the barriers faced by large and emerging businesses around the world by abstracting away the complexities of payments. Technical Operations roles in Payments are a dynamic and key component of Stripe's success.
What youâ€™ll do
TechOps roles in Money Movement are a dynamic and key component of Stripe's success. Focused on financial partner integrations and funds flow expansion, we sit at the intersection of product/platform engineers and financial partners, connecting them to ensure that everyone thrives and nothing is lost in translation. We partner closely with various other payment and infrastructure engineering teams to deeply understand and tackle the technical and real-world challenges of Stripeâ€™s payments stack. 
Responsibilities
Become a domain expert in an area of Stripeâ€™s money movement stack  
Handle inquiries from internal Stripes and external partners' technical teams, often requiring detailed investigation and sometimes code changes
Engage with Stripe's financial partners in EMEA to drive alignment on product usage, troubleshoot and solve technical problems or breakages 
Organize and direct complex technical changes and projects between Stripe and our partners
Identify and automate inefficient or unnecessary manual processes through code changes, partner agreements, or making and coordinating more complex code changes across Stripe
Design future anomaly detection systems and tools to ensure that data flowing through our partner and internal systems is reliable and correct
Collaborate across the company, including engineering, accounting, financial partnerships and product, to trace and account for billions of dollars moving through the Stripe platform
Who you are
Weâ€™re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. 
TechOps roles are one part coding and one part managing projects. The ideal candidate will have experience in both, but successful candidates may index more highly in one or the other. 
Minimum Qualifications 
Knowledge of and experience with payment and banking technologies and ecosystems in EMEA
Ability to write high quality code. We work mostly in Ruby and Java. However, languages can be learned: we care much more about your general coding skill than knowledge of a particular language or framework
Comfort with developer tools (e.g. git), and an ability to make well-scoped code changes in Stripe's codebase
Comfort using SQL to navigate Stripe's data and diagnose the scope and urgency of issues
Great communication skills, with an ability to frame messages appropriately for technical and non-technical audiences
Great technical problem-solving skills, with an ability to develop a working understanding of a technical system using a variety of methods. These include (but aren't limited to): reading/writing code, reading documentation or partner specifications, running debugging programs, reading logs, asking well-formed questions to domain experts, or digging into the raw data through various interfaces
Will to deliver results, with an ability to establish priorities and reliably execute on solutions (often with hard external deadlines)
Instinct to produce work that increases the impact of others, and helps us scale and grow (e.g. documentation, tools)

Additional Information

Your responses to the next few questions will help Stripe learn more about you & our talent community.

Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?
Which of Stripeâ€™s office locations are you interested in working from? Please select all that apply.

values.label: I am not interested in office-based opportunities

questions.label: If you are primarily applying for remote opportunities, please indicate which region(s) or countries you would prefer to work from. Please select all that apply.

values.label: I am not interested in remote working opportunities

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
